pullRequest.title: Initial support for MatchPredicates in Device REST API
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR introduces matchTerm query parameter in REST API simple queries.
Related Issue
No related issue
Description of the solution adopted
A new matchTerm query parameter is now available in Devices REST API. This query parameter will convert the value in a MatchPredicate. A MatchPredicate is a new kind of predicate that will match all the entities where at least one of the fields, that are hardcoded in every MatchPredicate implementation, starts with the provided value, case insensitive.
For DeviceMatchPredicate the following fields will be evaluated:

CLIENT_ID
DISPLAY_NAME
SERIAL_NUMBER
MODEL_ID
MODEL_NAME
BIOS_VERSION
FIRMWARE_VERSION
OS_VERSION
JVM_VERSION
OSGI_FRAMEWORK_VERSION
APPLICATION_FRAMEWORK_VERSION
CONNECTION_INTERFACE
CONNECTION_IP

Additional MatchPredicate implementations, for other entities, will be developed at a later time

beforeCommit.message:
Initial support for MatchPredicates in Device REST API

Signed-off-by: Claudio Mezzasalma <claudio.mezzasalma@eurotech.com>
